headline: June Bacon-Bercey, 90, Meteorologist
abstract: She is widely believed to have been the first African-American female meteorologist to forecast weather on television.
lead_paragraph: June Bacon-Bercey, who by many accounts became the first African-American woman to deliver the weather on television as a trained meteorologist, died on July 3 at a care facility in Burlingame, Calif., her family announced recently. She was 90.
